com.vpbank.services

Class AccountGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vpbank.services.AccountGenerator

  • public class AccountGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for generation account numbers
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Volodymyr Ponomarenko

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccountGenerator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static long genAccountNumberBasic(Client c)
      Generate bank account number (basic) According to the National Bank of Slovakia, to validate the basic part of the account number, the digits are multiplied by their respective weights (6,3,7,9,10,5,8,4,2,1), added up and divided by 11.
      static java.lang.String genAccountNumberIBAN(long accountNumberBasic, int accountNumberPrefix, short bankCode, java.lang.String countryCode)
      Generate IBAN form of the account number
      static int genAccountNumberPrefix(int start)
      Generate bank account number (prefix) According to the National Bank of Slovakia, to validate the prefix part of the account number, the digits are multiplied by their respective weights (10,5,8,4,2,1), added up and divided by 11.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccountGenerator

        public AccountGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • genAccountNumberBasic

        public static long genAccountNumberBasic(Client c)
        Generate bank account number (basic) According to the National Bank of Slovakia, to validate the basic part of the account number, the digits are multiplied by their respective weights (6,3,7,9,10,5,8,4,2,1), added up and divided by 11. The remainder must be zero.
        Parameters:
        c - instance of client - owner of the account will be created
        Returns:
        account number (basic)

      • genAccountNumberPrefix

        public static int genAccountNumberPrefix(int start)
        Generate bank account number (prefix) According to the National Bank of Slovakia, to validate the prefix part of the account number, the digits are multiplied by their respective weights (10,5,8,4,2,1), added up and divided by 11. The remainder must be zero.
        Parameters:
        start - set initialization value for account number generator
        Returns:
        account number (prefix)

      • genAccountNumberIBAN

        public static java.lang.String genAccountNumberIBAN(long accountNumberBasic,
                                                    int accountNumberPrefix,
                                                    short bankCode,
                                                    java.lang.String countryCode)
        Generate IBAN form of the account number
        Parameters:
        accountNumberBasic - bank account number (basic)
        accountNumberPrefix - bank account number (prefix)
        bankCode - bank national code
        countryCode - code of the country (e.g. SK for Slovakia)
        Returns:
        account number in IBAN format
